Fireworks Steering Committee Reconvening: 'speaker_1': 'Communication from Councilwoman Price Council Member Super Councilman Austin recommendation to request that the fireworks steering committee reconvene starting in March of 2016 through the 4th of July holiday in an effort to be proactive with fireworks, education and enforcement.'
'speaker_0': 'Thank you, Councilwoman Price.'

'speaker_5': 'Thank you. On September 22nd, the Public Safety Committee listened to testimony from numerous residents concerned with the use of illegal fireworks on the 4th of July holiday and months leading up to and after the holiday. In addition to the testimony given at Public Safety Committee, the mayor and city council offices received even more written communications and emails'

'speaker_5': 'from residents expressing identical concerns. In past years, the city led an effort to inform the public on the dangers of fireworks and that fireworks are illegal in the city of Long Beach. A fireworks steering committee met on a regular basis beginning in the month of March through the 4th of July holiday, in an effort to be proactive'

'speaker_5': 'with fireworks, education and enforcement. A number of city departments participated in the committee, including City Council, Harbor Public Works, Fire Police and Special Events and filming. The committee was responsible for such tasks as creating public service announcements and videos, press releases, distributing multilingual fliers, posting banners and signs, electronic messages, public education in schools, and notifying block party'

'speaker_5': 'permit holders that fireworks are illegal. The reestablishment of this committee is a step in the right direction to curb the use of fireworks in Long Beach and to conduct necessary public education and outreach. I would like to thank my City Council colleagues, SUPERHOT and Austin, for your support on the Public Safety Committee on this specific item.'
